description:
Do you create music?

Many artists, producers, and songwriters have lost big because their music wasn't properly protected, don't be one of them!!

According to copyright law, the composer/songwriter owns the copyright to a composition or song as soon as it's fixed in a tangible medium (written down or recorded). Registering your copyright with the Library of Congress makes this ownership part of the public record, and allows you to sue for monetary damages in the event of a legal dispute regarding the ownership of your songs and or compositions. You can complete the registration process online and protect your music internationally.

This course will take you step by step through the process of registering your music with the Library of Congress. You will see a live demonstration of the registration process of an actual music release. Each lecture covers a different aspect of the process. 

Stop worrying about your music and take the necessary steps to properly cover yourself!

Enroll now... Every second you wait someone could be stealing your music and costing your millions!

See you on the other side.
title: Copyright Basics: How to Register & Protect Your Music
